definitions.definition: A smooth surface, usually made of glass with reflective material painted on the underside, that reflects light so as to give an image of what is in front of it.
definitions.example: I had a look in the mirror to see if the blood had come off my face.

definitions.definition: An object, person, or event that reflects or gives a picture of another.
definitions.example: His story is a mirror into the life of orphans growing up.

definitions.definition: A disk, website or other resource that contains replicated data.
definitions.example: Although the content had been deleted from his blog, it was still found on some mirrors.

definitions.definition: A kind of political self-help book, advising kings, princes, etc. on how to behave.
Of an event, activity, behaviour, etc, to be identical to, to be a copy of.
To create something identical to (a web site, etc.).
To reflect, as in a mirror.
